intro: Hieracium tilingii, commonly known as the Tilingii hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish composite flowers arranged in a cluster, which are characteristic of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Hieracium tilingii is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in temperate regions across Europe.
